information.author: Hiral Goyal
information.content: The personal data of 54 lakh Twitter users has been put on sale on a hacker forum for $30,000 (about ₹24 lakh). The database contains information on users, including celebrities and companies, the hacker claimed. The hacker said they used a vulnerability that allows anybody without authentication to obtain any Twitter ID by submitting a phone number or an email.
information.title: Twitter data of 54 lakh users, including celebs, put on sale for ₹24 lakh by hacker

information.author: Ashley Paul
information.content: Google's former CEO Eric Schmidt said he had been "very naive" about the power of information in the early days of Google. Speaking at the Aspen Security Forum, Schmidt also expressed concern about the absence of a system for how artificial intelligence (AI) is developed or used. "Government...should put more pressure...to get these things consistent with our values," Schmidt added.
information.title: I was very naive about the power of information: Former Google CEO

information.author: Ashley Paul
information.content: A drone lifeguard service saved the life of a 14-year-old boy as he struggled against a powerful tide off a beach in Spain's Valencia, the drone's operators said. The drone dropped a life vest to help the boy stay afloat until a physical lifeguard team arrived. The boy was treated at a local hospital and was later sent home.
information.title: Drone lifeguard saves 14-year-old from drowning on a Spanish beach

information.author: Daisy Mowke
information.content: Scientists have said part of James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful telescope, suffered permanent damage due to a series of micrometeorite strikes. The micrometeoroid which hit a segment in the period May 22-24 caused significant uncorrectable change in the overall figure of that segment, said scientists. The telescope was built at a cost of $10 billion.
information.title: Part of world's most powerful telescope permanently damaged by space rock: Report

information.author: Anmol Sharma
information.content: A new picture taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, shows a purple galactic swirl in the universe. The image is of the centre of the spiral galaxy NGC 628. The image is a composite of three sets of data at different wavelengths taken by JWST’s mid-infrared instrument team.
information.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows purple galactic swirl in universe

information.author: Anmol Sharma
information.content: NASA's Perseverance rover spotted a string-like material that resembles a swirl of noodles. Sharing a picture, NASA said that the rover acquired the image of the area in front of it using its onboard Front Right Hazard Avoidance Camera A. The exact nature of the object is not known yet, with experts estimating that it could be debris.
information.title: Noodle-like object spotted on Mars, NASA releases pic

information.author: Hiral Goyal
information.content: India will kick off its first-ever 5G spectrum auction today, with four players looking to bid on 72 GHz of spectrum worth ₹4.3 lakh crore. Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea and new entrant Adani Data Networks are set to participate in the auction. The auction will be held for spectrum in various low, mid and high frequency bands.
information.title: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction begins today

information.author: Ankush Verma
information.content: After Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife Nicole Shanahan's lawyer said that "any suggestion that Nicole had an affair with Elon Musk is an outright lie", the Tesla CEO mocked Wall Street Journal's Investigations Editor Michael Siconolfi. "Sickonolfi has zero journalistic integrity," Musk tweeted. Shanahan's lawyer further said that the claim is also defamatory.
information.title: Elon Musk mocks journalist after Brin's wife's lawyer says 'Affair with Musk a lie'

information.author: Ashley Paul
information.content: Shopify is laying off 10% of its workforce, the e-commerce company said on Tuesday as it struggles with sales growth due to a post-pandemic slowdown in online shopping. Shopify had placed its bets on a pandemic-driven boom in online shopping. "It's now clear that the bet didn't pay off," CEO Tobias Lutke said. About 1,000 workers will reportedly be affected.
information.title: Shopify to lay off 10% of its workforce on slowing online orders

information.author: Hiral Goyal
information.content: Twitter told the Karnataka High Court that it has received "hundreds and thousands" of orders from the government to block certain accounts. "No intimation is given to the account holder that he has some objectionable tweet. Neither are we told anything," a lawyer appearing for Twitter said. "If this [continues], Twitter’s entire business will come to an end," he added.
information.title: Our business will end if we block users without giving reason: Twitter in HQ

information.author: Denis Maina
information.content: Earth clocked its shortest day ever on record on June 29, 2022, timeanddate.com reported citing data from the IERS. The planet completed a full spin on June 29, in a time that was 1.59 milliseconds shorter than the standard 24-hour rotation. It nearly broke the record again on July 26, with the day being 1.50 milliseconds shorter than 24 hours.
information.title: Earth clocks its shortest day ever on record

information.author: Denis Maina
information.content: Earth clocked its shortest day ever on record on June 29, 2022, timeanddate.com reported citing data from the IERS. The planet completed a full spin on June 29, in a time that was 1.59 milliseconds shorter than the standard 24-hour rotation. It nearly broke the record again on July 26, with the day being 1.50 milliseconds shorter than 24 hours.
information.title: Earth clocks its shortest day ever on record

information.author: Janet
information.content: The government has shared a list with the Lok Sabha showing the number of Twitter URLs blocked by the microblogging platform on Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology's orders. Twitter has blocked 1,122 URLs in 2022 till June, data provided by the government showed. In 2021, the number stood at 2,851 and in 2020, it stood at 2,731.
information.title: List shows number of URLs blocked by Twitter on govt's orders since 2014"
